alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 3:06AM CST until January 26 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. For the Caney Creek...including Splendora...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Caney Creek near Splendora. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM CST Thursday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.2 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.2 feet on 12/13/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Caney Creek Splendora 17.0 18.0 Thu 2 am CST 17.9 13.7 8.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later this morning.this evening at 915 PM CST.
